Reviews.Title: “Avoid Unless Desperate”
Reviews.Author: cley123
Reviews.Content: This is not a true hotel more a hostel. The restaurant attached is awful, the rooms claustrophobically small and it’s in the middle of an industrial estate. What else can I say, it’s a nightmare. I was booked in for three nights in error. The worst three nights I have ever spent in my travelling life.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills Hotel”
Reviews.Author: san142
Reviews.Content: stayed for 7 days. room was neat. internet is not free. parking is free. the rate of the hotel goes up depending on the demand. i got the room for 140 AED not 99 AED as they advertise. cost for the taxi from easyhotel to dubai terminal 2 came to 112 AED. on weekends the hotel is almost fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globalredneck
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, and for the price it was certainly an excellent place to stay. There are no frills, no fancy soap or shampoo, no room service, just a TV, and you receive the TV remote when checking in. The staff was friendly, the bed was comfortable. It was however, somewhat difficult to find the place.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: andy1mac
Reviews.Content: Only paid £20 for a double room which is cheap anywhere but in Dubai is exceptional value. OK Jebel Ali is the last stop on the Metro, but its so cheap to get there, £1.10 from the city, that it is'nt much of an issue. Takes about an hour to the city, but much less for the 'sights'. Rooms were adequate, particularly if you're the up and out type, and the beds were very comfortable. Like all easy facilities, you pay extra for the 'luxuries', for example room cleaning, towels changing etc so its up to you. Our additional bill came to 0, so you can see what we were like. All in all I would recommend it, only drawback being if you want a cab to anywhere back towards the city it starts off going the wrong way due to the motorway system and can be £5-6 before you start going the right way. Use the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rodeoankie
Reviews.Content: Hi I stayed 2 nights at this hotel, and was on business, since our client was in Jebel Ali. I can simply say that if your needs are limited to spending a few nights in Dubai, and if your work is based in Jebel Ali area, then this is the best bet, unless you are a 4-5 star lover. Both the hotel & its rooms (including bathrooms) are very clean and well kept. The std. rooms are small, but, adequate to spend a night, the TV has 4 free channels (including Dubai one english movies channel). Bed is comfy, sheets/duvets are good. There's a safe and a study table as well. There's an in-house restaurant (Stefafano's) that serves very good and fresh food, and has a great affordable menu, and a very welcoming owner. There are vending machines as well for beverages and chocolates (2-3 AED). Internet is avlb for 10 AED/hour or 15 AED for 6 hours, with a validiity of 30 days, and 8mbps speed and available via wireless in many rooms, depending on the floor. Great benefit. The only negative is accessibility with city, unless you are ok to walk 700 meters to the metro station. Trying to go back to Dubai in a taxi can cost a fortune, as the taxi will go towards Abu Dhabi to take a U-turn which is 6-8 km ahead. So, better use metro. Would be good if the hotel could have a shuttle car at least to the metro stn. All in all, a good, no hassle experience. Will recommend to anyone who needs to spend less and live basic in dubai for upto a week.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs and more...”
Reviews.Author: Xebec S
Reviews.Content: I returned this week to the easyhotel, as my initial stay in May was enjoyable and beyond expectations in terms of price and cleanliness. Now, however I had to run away, away from Crayfish smell left hanging in the corridors and rooms, AND away from the bedbugs that had been biting me in two different rooms (after they changed rooms). The staff however is aware and apologetic, but they were still quite happy accepting my payment for my sleepless nights. Real shame as this hotel could easily have been the best easyhotel, but now nothing easy about it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy”
Reviews.Author: Ankitjain
Reviews.Content: Although these ppl claim that rooms @100 dirhams but couldnt find that rate here.....we paid aroung 300 dirhams for one night for 1 room.....stayed here for 3 nights but the palce is comfortable....first of all it situated in jabel ali which is like the most secured area in the world and getting in and out of jabel ali everyday is really a pain and u need like thousand approvals for that....so staying in this hotel was easy for us to commute to our office in jabel ali.....breakfast was good and the staff was very cooperative.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed-asmaa
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is unbeatable. Rooms are comfortable. About 5mins drive to ibin batuta. 42" Tv with 4 free channels. Vending machines all over. For a place to sleep, it's just what you need.

HotelInfo.Name: easyHotel Dubai, Jebel Ali
HotelInfo.Address: Street 724 | Behind JAFZA #17, Dubai 17000, United Arab Emirates
